text: hey everybody Thomas Joe says here now a
really great salad should be light
bright and most importantly I think it
should be crisp in texture and today I'm
going to share with you four tricks in
salad success
what is the first tip well that's in
shopping your greens going out to the
farmers market or going to the grocery
store and buying greens that will hold
up when making a salad so I have a few
options here in front of me these are
sturdy crisp greens and the last a
little bit so when you build your salad
they won't get soggy and live examples
of crisp greens
this is romaine here which is nice and
sturdy I have Bibb lettuce here and dyed
which is a tiny bit bitter but really
crisp and crunchy is really great
radicchio should be so those are other
members of this family here would be
fantastic and kale so this is curly kale
here but you could also use Tuscan kale
anything that's kind of sturdy and crisp
works really well in making salads so my
preference would be to use these crisp
crunchy grains and that's the first tip
in making a crisp delicious salads the
second is in washing and thoroughly
drawing your greens now I have here a
mixture of Bibb lettuce and romaine and
I'm just washing them in a big bowl of
water here now if you bring your salad
greens home from the farmers market or
the supermarket and you notice that
they're a little limp they're slightly
wizened from the heat they're kind of
absent of moisture if you plunge them
pick them apart cut them into the pieces
you would like ultimately and throw them
in a bowl of ice water what will happen
is the water will rehydrate in the cold
ice will help to crisp up the greens
nicely and they should come back in
probably about a half an hour in that
mixture of ice and water so I'm using a
salad spinner today if you guys don't
have one of these at home make sure you
invest in one especially if you love
eating salads they're probably the most
important tool in making salads because
what they do is they get off all of the
water
from the green might be saying is it
really that important to have dry salad
greens and the answer is yes because if
you have wet salad greens what's going
to happen is that dressing that you put
on is going to immediately flip right
off of the lettuce leaves and so you're
going to have to use much more salad
dressing or vinaigrette to flavor your
salad and ultimately the more liquids
that you use the soggy ER salad is going
to get so having thoroughly dried greens
is very important not step number two
now giving this a little bit of a check
here you can see how much water actually
comes off of the greens if you do this a
few times your lettuce should be nice
and crisp and really nice and dry so
while this is hanging out here I'm going
to start on tip number three tip number
three is making a very flavorful salad
dressing oftentimes recipes will tell
you that you should use one part of
vinegar or acid and three parts of oil I
typically prefer to do a higher ratio of
vinegar because it has more flavor and
more bite I have some white wine vinegar
here this is about a quarter of a cup of
white wine vinegar you could use sherry
vinegar sherry vinegar is a very
flavorful vinegar again more flavor the
less you need to use I'm adding about a
tablespoon of Dijon mustard and Dijon
mustard is a really great ingredient to
have on hand not only for sandwiches but
in so many different salad dressings
it's extremely useful now you could use
whole-grain mustard that would be great
here if you love honey mustard that
would be fantastic
any type of mustard you have even a
little bit of mayonnaise what it does
that answer the flavor it creates an
emulsification and that emulsification
will help the vinaigrette stick to the
dry lettuce leaves so into my vinegar
and Dijon mixture here I'm going to add
a good amount of salt now I'm going to
do two hefty pinches here and you might
think wow so this little quantity of
vinegar and mustard that's a lot of salt
but what you're really doing is that
salt needs to flavor all of those
lettuce leaves so be generous and same
thing with pepper I'm going to add two
large pinches
of freshly ground peper here now if you
wanted to add spice or if you wanted to
add herbs you could certainly do that
that would be fantastic and also give
you more flavor and again more flavor
the less dressing you need to use and
the less weight on your lettuce leaves
which will make it soggy now I'm going
to add a teeny bit of sugar here just a
small pinch you're using honey mustard
you don't need to use sugar you could
even add a little bit of honey if you'd
like or even a tiny bit of maple syrup
would be really nice so I'm going to
whisk these ingredients together what
you're really looking to do in this step
is to dissolve the salt slightly in the
vinegar mix these ingredients up and
then drizzle in your olive oil I'm
really only going to use maybe a third
of a cup to a half of a cup of olive oil
and when you're making vinaigrette and
when you're buying olive oil for your
kitchen you want to make sure that you
have an olive oil that's really great
for cooking so something with maybe a
little bit more of a neutral flavor to
it you should also have on hand a more
flavorful olive oil for things like
salad dressings like this and also for
finishing things drizzling it over
wonderful mozzarella cheese really
flavorful olive oil will go a long way
because you don't need to use that much
of it so my vinaigrette is done and now
the fourth step in making a perfectly
crisp flavorful salad is in tossing the
salad together you might not have a
giant bowl like this at home but if
you're serious about your salads you
should invest in one this is a wide
shallow bowl and this is a real trick
here this is what everybody does in
restaurant a wide shallow bowl that you
can toss your salad and will help keep
it nice and crisp and you won't bruise
the lettuces and you won't over dress
them as well and you might be saying
what why why does this matter well a
wide Bowl you have more surface area and
what it's not doing is the lettuce
leaves aren't piled up on top of each
other in a narrow deep vessel so you
don't have to toss the lettuce as much
you just gently have to do it and your
vinaigrette here can go right around the

maybe two in a little bit more
and now you could use your hands if you

doesn't take much to toss the lettuce

in what is that a matter of a few
